job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA

review_title: *FOR THE NURSE OR NEW GRAD WHO IS DOING THEIR RESEARCH*
job_title: Staff RN in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Few of the nursing staff are friendly, all of the supervisors are awesome and friendly except for managgger-]
Ok, for New Grads (only if it's the last resource) take other offers, please.
cons:
Parking:  Very Small parking structure and parking car space are very narrow. I would have to come out very slowly, opened my car door just enough to let myself out. So, DO NOT bring your new car because it will end up scratch or dent. Also, be aware that they often get car break-in with windows shattered, which the hospital will not cover. (dayshift and nightshift)
Working Environment: In the summer, no proper air conditioning. They only have portable air conditioners and fans.  Not enough WOWs, and the only ones that do "work" are slow. They tried putting new ones, but they were worse. 
Management: they expect so much from the staff, but they do not solve the nurses issues. Time management is huge to them because they do not want to pay you overtime, yet, nurses are having difficulties because their WOWs are not working,  Doctors are lazy and expect you to put all their orders and few Doctors are rounding at shift change. It is hard to have that proper patient communication a nurse would like to have and provide the best care they deserve. 
Nursing Ratio: RN assignment is to take care of 5 patients (a mixture of MS and Tele patients) plus the 3 LVN covers, so eight total patients you are responsible for. Maybe it would work if some CNA helped and some older LVN were not lazy.

job_title: ER Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Coworkers were the best in my team. The supervisor was superb! The doctors and some nurses have been around for many years and have experience! no write ups when mistakes are done...
cons: Administrator personnel play favorites and give increases to whom they like the most. A particular doctor has his powertrips and is intimidating/ rude to nurses, Janitors take forever to come clean, and when they do its mediocre... Most securities are elders and could hardly protect any staff, psych patients roam the hallways... Their insurance once charged me a few thousand dollars for having an ER visit.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: - Free Coffee and strong floor staff teamwork.
cons:
- Not nearly enough parking; many employees have to park on the street and cars get broken into. 

- The hospital itself is dirty and run-down even with all the painting maintenance efforts.

- Computer systems commonly lose signal, go down, or glitch making it very difficult to complete documents, pass medications, or chart.

- The hospital runs out of common medical supplies often, making the job more difficult.

- Lots of broken/unusable equipment that has a long turn around to get repaired. Lack of usable equipment makes the job much more difficult than it needs to be.

- Very poor communication between the management and the floor staff. 

- Many small rooms crowded with four patients making it very difficult to work in.

- Low Pay

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Fellow staff members are awesome, this is what has kept me here. Easy going supervisors, great team work. Night shift is the way to go
cons: Limited resources, high turnover rate, poor pay rates, administration is a joke, Drs never put in their own orders and threaten your job if you tell them you can't place their orders.

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Fontana, CA
pros: Awesome people work here, that’s about it it.
cons: Administration doesn’t care about staff. Patient care is almost non-existent. It’s all about numbers here.

job_title: Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: No pros. Lots of disadvantages. As new grad nursestay away in this hospital. They don't have protocol. Some Charge nurse and super visor have no exp and skills. Some of them from nursing home with 2 or less years exp.
cons: Lots of cons. As new grad. Don't stay here longer than 6 months. Will makes you less smart. Too risky.

job_title: Staff RN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Flexible, independent environment. No one is looking over you judging you every move.
cons: Dirty, crowded community hospital.  Doctors don't have much interaction with nurses as MDs are usually off site. CT, MRI, Dialysis all has to be done by visiting third party companies. lazy nurses aren't reprimanded.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Norwalk, CA

cons: Alta hospitals continue to low ball their staffs, they much rather give better salary to new hires than take care of their loyal staffs. Lots of SNF placements, doctors control where patients go, no patient choice.
